snippet: With Washington mired in gridlock, some state political leaders are showing they can still get things done.
abstract: Many governors across the country are showing that it is possible to be successful and popular in elected office, even as Pres Obama and Congress are mired in partisan gridlock and suffering low poll numbers; contrast between statehouses and Washington is as stark as any in memory, reflecting not only the breakdown in the nation's capital but also a particularly activist class of governors.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Jonathan Martin from Washington. Marjorie Connelly contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: With Washington mired in gridlock, some state political leaders are showing they can still get things done.

headline.main: As Washington Keeps Sinking, Governors Rise
headline.print_headline: As Washington Keeps Sinking, Governors Rise
